 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקָה‎</span>] **verb** ==be empty(?), clean== ( Niph\`al ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ינקה‎</span> ***be unpunished***, so [[Eccl.40.15|Eccl 40:15]]; [[Eccl.31.5|Eccl 31:5]] = [[Prov.28.20|Prov 28:20]] Late Hebrew Pi\`el = Biblical Hebrew; Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נְקָא‎</span> Pa\`el = Biblical Hebrew, adjective <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְקֵא‎</span> ***clean***; Phoenician <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נקי‎</span> adjective ***pure***; Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נקא‎</span> ***be clean*** (perhaps) in proper name Sachau<sup>ZMG xxxv (1881), 735</sup> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>325</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nâkû***</u></abbr>, ***pour out, pour libation, make offering***, <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***nikû***</u></abbr>, ***libation, offering***; Old Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נקיה‎</span> perhaps = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוּקָיָה‎</span> ***libation*** ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>326</sup>), compare Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Cook|Cook]]<sup>83</sup>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Pa\`el ***pour out, make a libation***; on the other hand, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***purus, mundus fuit*** [[BDB#Kam|Kam]] [[BDB#Frey|Frey]]; II. ***cleanse***, etc., [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>3037</sup>. — Original meaning probably ***empty out***, hence ***pour*** and ***be empty, clean***); **\*\***<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְקָא‎</span> Pa\`el = ***cleanse*** (with lye) [[Isa.1.25|Isa 1:25]] adjective <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְקֵא‎</span> ***clean*** of bread or fruit [[Gen.40.16|Gen 40:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>J i</sup>, [[Deut.6.3|Deut 6:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>J ii</sup>, = ***exempt*** (Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקִי‎</span>) [[1Kgs.15.22|1Kgs 15:22]]. — 

**Qal** ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקֹה‎</span> [[Jer.49.12|Jer 49:12]] (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקֹה תִּנָּקֶה‎</span>, probably error for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הנקה ת‎</span>, compare [[Jer.25.29|Jer 25:29]]).

**Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקָּה‎</span> [[Zech.5.3|Zech 5:3]] + 5 t.; feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקְּתָה‎</span> [[Num.5.28|Num 5:28]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקָּ֑תָה‎</span> [[Isa.3.26|Isa 3:26]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקֵּיתָ‎</span> [[Gen.24.8|Gen 24:8]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקֵּיתִי‎</span> [[Judg.15.3|Judg 15:3]] + 2 t.; ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִנָקֶה‎</span> [[Prov.6.29|Prov 6:29]] + 6 t.; 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּנָּקֶה‎</span> [[Gen.24.41|Gen 24:41]] + 2 t.; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּנָּקוּ‎</span> [[Jer.25.29|Jer 25:29]] (twice in verse); ***Imperative*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנָּקֹי‎</span> [[Num.5.19|Num 5:19]] ***Infinitive*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנָּקִה‎</span> [[Jer.25.29|Jer 25:29]] — 

**1.** ***be cleaned out***, of a plundered city [[Isa.3.26|Isa 3:26]] ***purged out***, of liars and perjurers [[Zech.5.3|Zech 5:3]] (twice in verse). 

**2.** ***be clean, free from guilt, innocent***, [[Jer.2.35|Jer 2:35]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִפֶּשַׁע‎</span> [[Ps.19.14|Ps 19:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵעָוֺן‎</span> [[Num.5.31|Num 5:31]]([[BDB#P|P]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִפְּלִשְׁתִּים‎</span> ***from*** (at the hands of) ***the Philistines*** [[Judg.15.3|Judg 15:3]]. 

**3.** ***be free, exempt from punishment***, absolute [[Exod.21.19|Exod 21:19]] ([[BDB#E|E]]) [[Num.5.28|Num 5:28]] ([[BDB#P|P]]) [[1Sam.26.9|1Sam 26:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֹא יִנָּקֶה‎</span> [[Prov.6.29|Prov 6:29]]; [[Prov.11.21|Prov 11:21]]; [[Prov.16.5|Prov 16:5]]; [[Prov.17.5|Prov 17:5]]; [[Prov.19.5|Prov 19:5]]; [[Prov.19.9|Prov 19:9]]; [[Prov.28.20|Prov 28:20]]; [[Jer.25.29|Jer 25:29]] (3 t. in verse); [[Jer.49.12|Jer 49:12]] b, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָקֹה תִּנָּקֶה‎</span> v[[Jer.49.12|Jer 49:12]] a. 

**4.** ***free, exempt from obligation***, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִן‎</span>, from oaths [[Gen.24.8|Gen 24:8]]; [[Gen.24.41|Gen 24:41]] ([[BDB#J|J]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִמֵּי הַמָּרִים‎</span> from effects of drinking the bitter water [[Num.5.19|Num 5:19]] ([[BDB#P|P]]).

**Piel** ***Perfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקֵּיתִי‎</span> [[Josh.4.21|Josh 4:21]] ([[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִקַּמְתִּי‎</span>; so [[BDB#Now|Now]] [[BDB#SS|SS]] [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]); ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְנַקֶּה‎</span> [[Exod.20.7|Exod 20:7]] + 2 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְנַקֵּ֑ה‎</span> [[Num.14.18|Num 14:18]]; [[Nah.1.3|Nah 1:3]] 2 masculine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַקֵּנִי‎</span> [[Job.9.28|Job 9:28]]; [[Job.10.14|Job 10:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּנַקֵּהוּ‎</span> [[1Kgs.2.9|1Kgs 2:9]] 1 singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲנַקֶּ֑ךָּ‎</span> [[Jer.30.11|Jer 30:11]]; [[Jer.46.28|Jer 46:28]] ***Imperative*** suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַקֵּנִי‎</span> [[Ps.19.13|Ps 19:13]] ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַקֵּה‎</span> [[Exod.34.7|Exod 34:7]] + 4 t.; — 

**1.**. ***hold innocent, acquit***, [[Job.9.28|Job 9:28]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵעֲוֺנִי‎</span> [[Job.10.4|Job 10:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִנִּסְתּרוֺת‎</span> [[Ps.19.13|Ps 19:13]]. 

**2.** ***leave unpunished:*** of man, with accusative [[1Kgs.2.9|1Kgs 2:9]] elsewhere of God: absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַקֵּה לאֹ יְנַקֶּה‎</span> [[Exod.34.7|Exod 34:7]] (twice in verse) = [[Num.14.18|Num 14:18]] (twice in verse) (all [[BDB#J|J]]) = [[Nah.1.3|Nah 1:3]] (twice in verse); with accusative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לאֹ יְנַקֶּה‎</span> [[Exod.20.7|Exod 20:7]] = [[Deut.5.11|Deut 5:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נַקֵּה לאֹ אֲנַקֶּךָּ‎</span> [[Jer.30.11|Jer 30:11]] (twice in verse) = [[Jer.46.28|Jer 46:28]] (twice in verse), compare [[Joel.4.21|Joel 4:21]] (twice in verse) (but see above).
